member.summary: Disposes the object and all the socket objects.
member.remarks: Calling this method ensures that all resources are freed. It is not necessary to call this method if the FTP session is successfully closed using Disconnect method.

member.summary: Finalizer. Called by garbage collector during object destruction.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the current operation.

remarks.p: The operation need not end immediately, it will finish within the interval specified by AbortTimeout. Aborting data transferring operations (including , , and GetItems) may take twice the amount of time specified by .

The aborted operation will end either successfully, or with of status OperationAborted or Timeout. The object may remain in Reading, Sending or Processing state. In this case, call to get back to the Ready state.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.ClearCommandChannel
member.summary: Reverts the protected control connection back to plaintext connection.

remarks.p: Implements the FTP CCC (Clear Command Channel) command.
This command is used in circumstances where it is desirable to protect the control connection only during authentication, when user credentials are being sent by the client.
When the control connection is reverted to plaintext, subsequent data transfers will be protected with the current settings.

The pathname to rename the file or directory to.
member.remarks: Represents FTP RNFR/RNTO command pair.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetRawList(System.String,Rebex.Net.FtpListingType)
member.summary: Retrieves the raw list of files and directories as received from the server.
member.param: Arguments for the list command.
The listing command to use.
member.returns: The array of response lines.

remarks.p: This method supports retrieving the raw listings using either the LIST command or MLSD command. Using GetList is a better choice in most cases, because it returns the parsed list, unlike .
Please note that requesting a FtpListingType.MachineProcessingList list will only work on servers that support this extension - this can be determined using the property.

Caution: The meaning of the arguments argument is not defined by RFC and varies from server to server. Some servers interpret it as parameters to dir command, some as a filename, some ignore it and some report an error. Calling this method with arguments other than null is not recommended and will make your code incompatible with many FTP servers.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetList(System.String)
member.summary: Returns parsed list of files and directories.
member.param: Arguments for the LIST or MLSD command.
member.returns: An instance of containing the file list.

remarks.p: This method will use the MLSD command if the server supports it and it is enabled (see and properties). It will use the LIST command if MLSD is not supported or disabled.
See for information on using custom list parsers.

Caution: The meaning of the arguments argument is not defined by RFC and varies from server to server. Some servers interpret it as parameters to dir command, some as a filename, some ignore it and some report an error. Calling this method with arguments other than null is not recommended and will make your code incompatible with many FTP servers.

remarks.p: This method will use the MLSD command if the server supports it and it is enabled (see and properties). It will use the LIST command if MLSD is not supported or disabled.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetFile(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Downloads the remote file to the data stream.
member.param: The path of the remote file.
The output stream.
The starting offset of the remote file.
member.returns: Number of bytes transferred.

remarks.p: Represents FTP RETR command.

The path parameter can specify either relative or absolute path. Relative path is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. Use GetCurrentDirectory to obtain the current working directory.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetFile(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Downloads the remote file to the local file.
member.param: The path of the remote file.
The path of the local file. This cannot be a directory.
The starting offset of the remote file.
The starting offset in the local file.
member.returns: Number of bytes transferred.

remarks.p: Represents FTP RETR command.
If the specified local file does not exist, it is created; if it does exist and the local offset is greater than 0, the contents after the offset are overwritten.
If the localOffset is less than or equal to zero and the file exists, it will be truncated to zero length before the transfer starts.

The path parameter can specify either relative or absolute path. Relative path is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. Use GetCurrentDirectory to obtain the current working directory.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.CreateDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a directory on the server.
member.param: Pathname of the new remote directory.
member.returns: A string containing the absolute path of the newly created remote directory if the server complies to RFC 959; otherwise, null reference is returned.

remarks.p: Represents FTP MKD command.

CAUTION: RFC states that successful reply to the MKD command must always contain the absolute path of the created directory. However, many FTP servers do not comply to this requirement, for example wu-ftpd 2.4.2, (which is still widely used, although newer releases fixed this bug). Therefore, when the response is unparsable, this method returns a null reference instead of throwing an exception.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.Login(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the FTP server.
member.param: The username.
Password for the given username.
Account for the given username.
member.returns: The logon message returned by the remote server.

remarks.p: Represents FTP USER/PASS/ACCT command triplet.
For anonymous logins, use "anonymous" as a username and an email as a password (and no account).
If userName is a null reference, "anonymous" is used. If password is a null reference, "guest" is used.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.SetFileDateTime(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets the modification date and time of the specified remote file. Not all FTP servers support this!
member.param: The path of the remote file.
The date and time to set.

remarks.p: Support for setting modification date and time, either using MFMT or MDTM command, is not as widespread as retrieving it. This method will fail on servers that support neither of these commands.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetFileLength(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified remote file.
member.param: The path of the remote file. This cannot be a directory.
member.returns: The size of the specified file in bytes.

remarks.p: Represents FTP SIZE command.
The SIZE command was not defined by the original RFC, but it has been widely supported for a number of years.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Detects whether the specified file exists on the server. Not all FTP servers support this!
member.param: The path of the remote file to check.
member.returns: True if the file exists, false otherwise.

remarks.p: The standard FTP protocol does not have a dedicated command that could be used to detect whether a file exists. There is the MLST command that is quite reliable, but not all server support it and we have to rely on SIZE or even PWD, CWD commands for these servers.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.DirectoryExists(System.String)
member.summary: Detects whether the specified directory exists on the server. Not all FTP servers support this!
member.param: The path of the remote directory to check.
member.returns: True if the directory exists, false otherwise.

remarks.p: The standard FTP protocol does not have a dedicated command that could be used to detect whether a directory exists. There is the MLST command that is quite reliable, but not all server support it and we have to rely on MDTM, SIZE or even PWD, CWD commands for these servers.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.SendCommand(System.String)

remarks.p: Must be followed by a call to ReadResponse method.

remarks.p: Must be preceded by a successful call to SendCommand method.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.Flush(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads and returns control connection data, if available.
member.param: The length of time (in milliseconds) to wait for data to be received.
member.returns: FtpResponse if data was read or null reference if no data was read.

remarks.p: Reads and returns any control connection data that might have remained unread after an asynchronous operation aborted by a call to Abort method.
It can also be used to read FTP server messages that are not responses to any commands.

If the state of the object is Ready and no data is available, this method returns immediately with a null reference. If the state of the Ftp object is Reading, Sending or Processing and no data is available within the specified time limit, it returns with a null reference. If data is available, it is read and returned. If the object is in any other state, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetNameList(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of names.
member.param: Arguments for the NLST command.
member.returns: An array of names.

remarks.p: Represents FTP NLST command.

Actual behavior of NLST command varies from server to server, because the RFC is not clear in explaining what it should do. Some servers return the names of both files and directories, others return files only or even report error if the current directory is empty. Using GetList is a better choice in most cases.

Caution: The meaning of the arguments argument is not defined by RFC and varies from server to server. Some servers interpret it as parameters to ls command, some as a filename, some ignore it and some report an error. Calling this method with arguments other than null is not recommended and will make your code incompatible with many FTP servers.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.ClearCommandChannelAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous ClearCommandChannel operation. Reverts the protected control connection back to plaintext connection.

remarks.p: Implements the FTP CCC (Clear Command Channel) command.
This command is used in circumstances where it is desirable to protect the control connection only during authentication, when user credentials are being sent by the client.
When the control connection is reverted to plaintext, subsequent data transfers will be protected with the current settings.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetRawListAsync(System.String,Rebex.Net.FtpListingType,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetRawList operation. Retrieves the raw list of files and directories as received from the server.
member.param: Arguments for the list command.
The listing command to use.

remarks.p: This method supports retrieving the raw listings using either the LIST command or MLSD command. Using GetList is a better choice in most cases, because it returns the parsed list, unlike .
Please note that requesting a FtpListingType.MachineProcessingList list will only work on servers that support this extension - this can be determined using the property.

Caution: The meaning of the arguments argument is not defined by RFC and varies from server to server. Some servers interpret it as parameters to dir command, some as a filename, some ignore it and some report an error. Calling this method with arguments other than null is not recommended and will make your code incompatible with many FTP servers.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The array of response lines.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetRawListAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetRawList operation. Retrieves the raw list of files and directories in the current server directory as received from the server.

remarks.p: Represents FTP LIST command.
Because the RFC does not define the format of the file list, this method is often useless. Using GetList is a better choice in most cases.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The array of response lines.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetFileAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetFile operation. Downloads the remote file to the local file.
member.param: The path of the remote file.
The path of the local file. This cannot be a directory.
The starting offset of the remote file.
The starting offset in the local file.

remarks.p: Represents FTP RETR command.
If the specified local file does not exist, it is created; if it does exist and the local offset is greater than 0, the contents after the offset are overwritten.
If the localOffset is less than or equal to zero and the file exists, it will be truncated to zero length before the transfer starts.

The path parameter can specify either relative or absolute path. Relative path is interpreted as relative to the current working directory. Use GetCurrentDirectory to obtain the current working directory.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: Number of bytes transferred.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.CreateDirectoryAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous CreateDirectory operation. Creates a directory on the server.
member.param: Pathname of the new remote directory.

remarks.p: Represents FTP MKD command.

CAUTION: RFC states that successful reply to the MKD command must always contain the absolute path of the created directory. However, many FTP servers do not comply to this requirement, for example wu-ftpd 2.4.2, (which is still widely used, although newer releases fixed this bug). Therefore, when the response is unparsable, this method returns a null reference instead of throwing an exception.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A string containing the absolute path of the newly created remote directory if the server complies to RFC 959; otherwise, null reference is returned.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.LoginAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Login operation. Authenticates the user to the FTP server.
member.param: The username.
Password for the given username.
Account for the given username.

remarks.p: Represents FTP USER/PASS/ACCT command triplet.
For anonymous logins, use "anonymous" as a username and an email as a password (and no account).
If userName is a null reference, "anonymous" is used. If password is a null reference, "guest" is used.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The logon message returned by the remote server.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous Login operation. Authenticates the user to the FTP server.

remarks.p: Represents FTP USER/PASS command pair.
For anonymous logins, use "anonymous" as a username and an email as a password.
If userName is a null reference, "anonymous" is used. If password is a null reference, "guest" is used.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The logon message returned by the remote server.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous SetFileDateTime operation. Sets the modification date and time of the specified remote file. Not all FTP servers support this!
member.param: The path of the remote file.
The date and time to set.

remarks.p: Support for setting modification date and time, either using MFMT or MDTM command, is not as widespread as retrieving it. This method will fail on servers that support neither of these commands.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetFileLength operation. Returns the size of the specified remote file.
member.param: The path of the remote file. This cannot be a directory.

remarks.p: Represents FTP SIZE command.
The SIZE command was not defined by the original RFC, but it has been widely supported for a number of years.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The size of the specified file in bytes.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.FileExistsAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous FileExists operation. Detects whether the specified file exists on the server. Not all FTP servers support this!
member.param: The path of the remote file to check.

remarks.p: The standard FTP protocol does not have a dedicated command that could be used to detect whether a file exists. There is the MLST command that is quite reliable, but not all server support it and we have to rely on SIZE or even PWD, CWD commands for these servers.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: True if the file exists, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.DirectoryExistsAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous DirectoryExists operation. Detects whether the specified directory exists on the server. Not all FTP servers support this!
member.param: The path of the remote directory to check.

remarks.p: The standard FTP protocol does not have a dedicated command that could be used to detect whether a directory exists. There is the MLST command that is quite reliable, but not all server support it and we have to rely on MDTM, SIZE or even PWD, CWD commands for these servers.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: True if the directory exists, false otherwise.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous KeepAlive operation. Sends the NOOP command to the server to keep the connection alive.

remarks.p: Represents FTP NOOP command.
Call this if you do not want the connection to the server to time out.
Some servers ignore NOOP command.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetNameListAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetNameList operation. Retrieves the list of names.
member.param: Arguments for the NLST command.

remarks.p: Represents FTP NLST command.

Actual behavior of NLST command varies from server to server, because the RFC is not clear in explaining what it should do. Some servers return the names of both files and directories, others return files only or even report error if the current directory is empty. Using GetList is a better choice in most cases.

Caution: The meaning of the arguments argument is not defined by RFC and varies from server to server. Some servers interpret it as parameters to ls command, some as a filename, some ignore it and some report an error. Calling this method with arguments other than null is not recommended and will make your code incompatible with many FTP servers.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An array of names.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetNameListAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetNameList operation. Retrieves the list of names in the current server directory.

remarks.p: Represents FTP NLST command.

Actual behaviour of NLST command varies from server to server, because the RFC is not clear in explaining what it should do. Some servers return the names of both files and directories, others return files only or even report error if the current directory is empty. Using GetList is a better choice in most cases.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An array of names.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetSystemName operation. Returns the name of the remote OS.

remarks.p: Represents FTP SYST command.
Some servers do not support SYST command and most servers return very inaccurate responses.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The name of the remote OS.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.SiteAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous Site operation. Executes site-specific command and returns the response.
member.param: Site-specific command.

remarks.p: Represents FTP SITE command.
Using SendCommand and ReadResponse method might be a better choice in some cases.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: Command-specific response.

Traversal mode. Specifies whether the whole hierarchy or files only are transferred.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.ChangeDirectoryAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous ChangeDirectory operation. Changes the current working directory on the server.
member.param: Pathname of the directory to change to.

remarks.p: Implemented using FTP CWD command for pathnames not equal to ".." and CDUP command for ".." pathnames. "." pathnames are ignored.
Caution: some uncommon servers do not use a slash as a directory separator. Do not use slashes in the path to remain compatible with such servers.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.RemoveDirectoryAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous RemoveDirectory operation. Deletes an empty remote directory with the specified pathname.
member.param: Remote directory pathname.
member.remarks: Represents FTP RMD command.
member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetCurrentDirectoryAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetCurrentDirectory operation. Gets the absolute path of the current working directory on the remote server.

remarks.p: Represents FTP PWD command.
Some servers (e.g. TOPS-20) do not support this method. with status of FtpExceptionStatus.ProtocolError and code of 550 is thrown if this is the case.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A string containing the absolute path of the current working remote directory.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.Ftp.GetFileDateTimeAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins asynchronous GetFileDateTime operation. Returns the modification date and time of the specified remote file.
member.param: The path of the remote file. This cannot be a directory.

remarks.p: Represents FTP MDTM command.
The MDTM command was not defined by the original RFC, but it has been widely supported for a number of years.
Some servers return times in their local time zones, some use GMT.

member.param: An optional user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A structure set to date and time that the specified file was modified.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.Passive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies the way data transfers are made.
member.value: The file transfer type. Default is true (passive).

remarks.p: Passive mode - data transfer connections are made by the client, which connects to the server.
Active mode - data transfer connections are made by the server, which connects to the client.
Firewalls and NATs often make it impossible to use active transfers.
When the transport layer doesn't support incoming connections, this property is ignored and all transfers are passive (for example when using HTTP CONNECT proxy).

member.value: Extensions supported by the server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bit field specifying the enabled extensions.
member.value: Enabled extensions.
member.remarks: Enabled extensions will be used when appropriate. By default, all extensions are enabled.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.MaxDownloadSpeed

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.MaxUploadSpeed

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.UploadBufferLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the upload buffer. Allowed values are 2KB to 16MB. Default is 16KB (4KB on .NET CF).
member.value: Upload buffer size.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.DataPortRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the local TCP port range used for data transfers. Please note that is usually only useful for active mode (see ), not in passive mode, where only the port range specified at the server is usually important. In passive mode, only set this property if you know precisely what you are doing, because setting it to a range that is too small or corresponds to the server range might often lead to inability to transfer many files!
member.value: The port range.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.DataAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address announced to the FTP server when establishing an active mode data transfer. Don't set this unless needed. By default, the value of this property is IPAddress.None which means that the address of the listening interface is used instead. This has no effect for passive mode transfers.
member.value: IP address.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.SecureTransfers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies whether data transfers are secure.
member.value: True if data transfers are secure, false if unsecure.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.IsSecured
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the control connection is secured.
member.value: True if secure, false if not secure.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.TlsSocket
member.summary: Returns the TLS/SSL socket of secured control connection.
member.returns: The TLS/SSL socket of secured control connection, or null if the connection is not secured.
member.remarks: This property is intended for advanced users only. class does not expect the socket to be altered in any way.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
The property only affects synchronous methods. To time out asynchronous methods, use the method.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.AbortTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the abort operation times out.
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the abort operation times out. Default is 3000, which seems to be a reasonable value.
member.remarks: Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.IsBusy
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there is any operation (method) in progress.
member.returns: True if there is any operation in progress; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.value: True if connected; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.Ftp.IsAuthenticated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is authenticated.
member.value: True if authenticated; false otherwise.

member.summary: Specifies various FTP settings.

member.summary: Creates a new object that is a shallow copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a shallow copy of the current instance.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.DoNotSendSignals
member.summary: Do not send abort signals when aborting download.

remarks.p: RFC 959 and RFC 1123 recommend sending IP and Synch signals before the ABOR command. Many FTP servers even ignore an ABOR command without the preceding IP and Synch signals. The default behavior of Rebex FTP for .NET is to send IP and Synch, unless a proxy is in use.
However, there are some bad FTP servers that react in an inappropriate way to IP and Synch signals. Problems with some network setups were also experienced.
Setting this flag will disable sending of IP and Synch signals even through non-proxied FTP sessions. You might want to try disabling it if you experience problems while aborting data transfers.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.DoNotSendAbort
member.summary: Do not send the ABOR command when aborting download.

remarks.p: This flag will cause the component not to send ABOR command while aborting a download. The download will be aborted by closing the receiving socket.
Caution: Only use this if you know what you are doing and why you need this. Please note that some servers might react by closing the control connection.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.KeepAliveDuringTransfer
member.summary: Send NOOP command during file transfers every 10 minutes.
member.remarks: This is only needed if the FTP control connection is otherwise being dropped by a buggy router or firewall while a very long data transfer is in progress.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ForceSilentCcc
member.summary: This option is deprecated and should no longer be used.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ForceActiveCcc
member.summary: Forces the CCC command behavior that was used by older Rebex FTP/SSL releases.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.SendDataAsynchronously
member.summary: Deprecated. Doesn't have any effect now.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.TimeoutAsynchronousMethods
member.summary: Makes property affect asynchronous methods as well. By default, it only affects the synchronous methods.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.DoNotDetectFeatures
member.summary: Disables feature detection using FEAT and other commands.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.IgnorePassiveModeAddress
member.summary: Overrides an IP address announced by the server in response to PASV command with an IP used by the control connection.
member.remarks: This option is only active when not connected through a proxy.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.EnableMultipleBlockingCalls
member.summary: Makes it possible to call multiple methods from different threads at once. The calls will block until the operation is completed.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.PauseBeforeUploadClose
member.summary: Performs a small pause before closing the encrypted upload connection when the transfer is finished. Used as a workaround for servers that are unable to correctly handle the last block data if it is followed by a TLS CloseNotify message in the same TCP block.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.DisableInvalidPassiveModeAddressWorkaround
member.summary: Disables a workaround for FTP servers that announce private range IP addresses even though a public IP was used to connect to them. By default, when such server is detected, an IP address announced by the server in response to PASV command used is overrode with an IP used by the control connection.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.EnableControlConnectionFlushing
member.summary: Enables reading and throwing out any unexpected incoming responses when sending an FTP command.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ConnectPassiveLater
member.summary: Makes the passive mode transfer initialize the connection only after the LIST/NLST/RETR/STOR command has been sent.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.UseLargeBuffers
member.summary: Use larger receive buffer for incoming and outgoing data.
member.remarks: Not supported on Universal Windows Platform.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ReuseControlConnectionSession
member.summary: Re-use control connection session ID for data connections.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ForceListHiddenFiles
member.summary: Use "LIST -la" instead of "LIST" in / methods.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.DisableProgressPercentage
member.summary: Disables progress percentage reporting through event.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.MultiFileLinkMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the default processing mode of detected links in multi-file operations.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.MultiFileMoveMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the default move behavior in multi-file transfers.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.RestoreDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates which date/time is restored after successful transfer if possible. Please note that FTP protocol supports LastWriteTime only (CreationTime and LastAccessTime are not supported).
member.remarks: Not supported on Universal Windows Platform.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.TimeComparisonGranularity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies granularity for time comparisons.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.RecheckItemExistence
member.summary: In multi-file operations it forces checking, whether currently processing item still exists.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.PreferredChecksumType
member.summary:
Gets or sets a checksum type to be preferred in multi-file operations when FTP server supports several checksum types.
Default value: SHA1.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.KeepAliveDuringTransferInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of interval (in seconds) between NOOP commands sent during transfer when the option is enabled.
member.value: The length of interval, in seconds, between successive NOOP commands. Default is 600.

remarks.p: Minimal value is 30. Setting this to a value lower than 30 will set it to 30.
The option is only needed if the FTP control connection is otherwise being dropped by a buggy router or firewall while a very long data transfer is in progress.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ForceMdtmForGetFileDateTime
member.summary: Forces MDTM command to be always used by instead of MLST (which is used when available by default).

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.UploadCommand
member.summary: Specifies FTP command for uploading files. STOR is used by default.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.UseLegacyPaths
member.summary: Specifies whether to use old API style paths (relative) or new API style paths (absolute) in multi-file transfers.
member.value: False (default) to use absolute paths; true to use relative paths.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ForceSimpleDirectoryExists
member.summary: Specifies whether to just use a combination of PWD and CWD commands when determining remote directory existence.
member.value: False (default) to use additional commands (such as MLSD and MLST) as well; true to only use PWD and CWD commands.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.RaiseEventsFromCurrentThread
member.summary: Specifies whether to raise asynchronous events from the current working thread or whether to raise them using a available when an asynchronous operation was started.
member.value: False (default) raise events using ; true to raise them directly from the current working thread.
member.remarks: Events of synchronous methods are always raised from the current working thread.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.As400ListingDateFormat
member.summary: Forces listing date format on AS/400 like systems. Format is 'DMY' for day,month,year; 'MDY' for month, day, year; and so on.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.DisableImplicitAs400NameFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically issue `SITE NAMEFMT 1` command when AS/400 system is detected in a batch operation such as or . Default is false, which means the `SITE NAMEFMT 1` is issued.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.SslUpgradeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of TLS/SSL initialization for explicit TLS/SSL mode.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.SslReuseSessions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to reuse TLS/SSL sessions for data transfers. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.ForceExtendedDataChannelCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use EPSV/EPRT commands to initiate a data channel.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.AlwaysResolveServerName
member.summary: Always resolves the server hostname by performing a DNS query. This means a DNS query will be done when using any proxy as well.
member.remarks: Not supported on Universal Windows Platform.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.EnableFactsNegotiation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to attempt to negotiate extended MLST/MLSD facts using OPTS MLST command.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level used when uploading in mode Z (Zlib). Possible values are 0-9, where 0 means no compression (fastest) and 9 means best compression (slowest). Default value is 6 (medium compression and speed).
member.value: Compression level.
member.remarks: Applies to upload operations only. For download operations, the compression level is determined by the FTP server itself.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.SkipDuplicateItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to skip duplicate items in directory listings or whether to fail.
member.value: True to skip duplicate items; false to throw an exception.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.BackslashIsRemoteDirectorySeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the backslash '\' is remote directory separator when working with paths (in addition to slash '/').
member.value: True to use slash '/' and backslash '\' as remote directory separator; false to use only slash '/' as remote directory separator.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.FtpSettings.EnableDummyRenameForFileExists
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use RNFR/RNTO commands to determine remote file existence. Only supported for Windows CE FTP server.
